answer1: The lines $r$ and $s$ are equal if $m=-2$, parallel if $m=2$, and secant otherwise.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & 0 \\
x & - & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,0,\,1+y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,y,\,0,\,z\right)$ as solutions for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & = & 2 \\
3x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & - & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has two solutions, $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ and $\left(2,\,1,\,0\right)$.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(-4+z,\,z,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Construct the dual problem for the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 2x_{1} + 7x_{2} + 4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & x_{1} + 2x_{2} + x_{3}\leq 10\\ 
& 3x_{1}+3x_{2}+2x_{3}\leq 10\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
answer1:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]
answer2:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\leq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} &  u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer4:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+u_{2}\\
	   	    \text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]

answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$

question: Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system the plane of equation $\pi: 2x-3y+z-1=0$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(-1, -1, 0)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(-4, 6, -2)$.
answer2: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, 3, 1)$.
answer3: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 1)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.
answer4: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, -1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.

question:
Solve the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Let $T:\mathbb{R}^2\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ be the linear transformation given by $T(x,y)=(x-y,0,3x-3y)$. Indicate which of the following vector is in kernel of $T$.

$5= 4 e^{3x}$
Consider $x^3+5=9x$. Find $x_3$ using the secant method (considering $x_0=0.5$ and $x_1$=1.0).

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & 3z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
2x & - & y & - & z & + & t & = & 0 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{4}t-\frac{7}{12},\frac{3}{4}t-\frac{3}{4},t\bigg)$, for all $t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{7}{12},-\frac{3}{4},0\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The solution of the system is the vector of coordinates $(2,-1,0,0)$.

$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}
 1  & 1  & 0 \\
  -1 & -k  & k-1 \\
  3 & 2  & 2k+1
\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & = & 2 \\
3x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & - & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has two solutions, $\left(-1,\,3,\,3\right)$ and $\left(2,\,1,\,0\right)$.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions, which are of the form $\left(-4+z,\,z,\,z\right)$ for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
